classFeature.name: Sigili Glyphs
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain a number of Sigili Glyphs equal to your Exorcist level. These glyphs can be expended to power certain Exorcist features. You regain all expended Sigili Glyphs when you finish a long rest. Some of your Exorcist features require your Sigili Glyph DC, which is 8 + your Charisma modifier + your Proficiency Bonus.

classFeature.name: Glyph Crafter
entries: Once per day, you can take 1 hour in order to magically create a number of Sigili Glyphs equal to your Proficiency Bonus with your Painter's Supplies. This can be done while taking a Short Rest.

classFeature.name: Burning Attack
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend any number of Sigili Glyph (Minimum of 1) to ignite the weapon on fire, dealing additional fire damage 1d6.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Glyph Seals
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to manipulate the power of the spirits to suit your needs. You gain two of the following Glyph Seal options of your choice. You gain another one at 6th level. You can use only one Glyph Seal on a Sigili Glyph when you use it, unless otherwise noted.

items: Spiritual Armor: As a bonus action, you expend one Sigili Glyph in a piece of armor that is within 30 ft of you. If it was a Medium armor or Light armor, it uses your Charisma modifier for the AC calculation for 8 hours and gains a bonus of +1 to AC.

Rage from beyond: As a bonus action, you expend two Sigili Glyph to bolster your attacks by the otherworldly spirits for 1 minute. When you attack with a weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack rolls. You deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

Mend the Broken: As a bonus action, you expend any number of Sigili Glyph (Minimum of 1) and target a creature within 60ft of you, the target regains a number of d4's equal to de number of Sigily Glyphs expended.

Incorporeal Embodiment: As a bonus action, you expend one Sigili Glyph to take the Disengage Action, your speed doubles, you become immune to being Grappled, Restrained and affected by field effects that would reduce your movement speed for the rest of the turn.

Unresting wrath: As a bonus action, you expend any number of Sigili Glyph (Minimum of 1) to infuse your weapon with the power of the spirits which sorround you for 1 minute. The next attack you make with the infused weapon, it unleashes a pulse of wrathful energy surrounding the target of the attack, each creature in a 10ft radius must make a Charisma saving throw against your Glyph DC or take a numer of d8's of force damage equal to the number of Sigili Glyphs expended on a failed save and half as much on a succesful one. You can choose a number of allies to automatically succeed the saving throw Equal to your Charisma modifier and take no damage.

classFeature.name: Exorcist Ancestry Discovery
entries: At 3rd level, you find out the secrets about your exorcist ancestors, each of which is detailed at the end of the class's description. Your choice grants you features at 5th level and again at 9th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exorcist Ancestry Feature
entries: At 5th level, you gain a feature granted by your Exorcist Ancestry choice.

classFeature.name: Glyph Seals
entries: At 6th level, you learn an additional Glyph Seals option.

classFeature.name: Connection With The Far Beyond
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend half of your Sigili Glyphs to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you were reduced to 0 hit points by a creature, you can make it do a Wisdom saving throw against your Glyph DC, and on a fail save, that creature is Restrained and take a numer of d6's equal to your Proficiency bonus of Necrotic damage at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute. The creature can use its action to try to end these effects. You recover half of the damage done by this feature as hit points.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exorcist Ancestry Feature
entries: At 9th level, you gain a feature granted by your Exorcist Ancestry choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Devote Of The Eternal Garden
entries: You can target a creature that you can see within 60ft of you, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Glyph DC. A willing creature can automatically fail the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is Charmed, its speed is reduced to 0, and it is incapacitated. The creature's maximum hit points are reduced by half at the start of each of its turns. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end these effects.
You can only use this feature once per long rest. If the target was immune to being Charmed, you can use this feature again once.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

optionalfeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Defense
entires: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entires: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entires: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entires: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Fighting
entires: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're {@condition blinded} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

optionalfeature.name: Interception
entires: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by 1d10 + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Reaper Ancestry
entries: In the annals of your lineage, you discover a legacy of formidable ancestors. They were warriors of unparalleled valor, their loyalty as steadfast as the blades they wielded to vanquish their enemies. Yet, even in death, they sought no respite.

These ancestral spirits chose to remain vigilant, guiding their progeny from the spectral realm. They helped their descendants unlock their latent Exorcist abilities, revealing their true potential and nature. These ancestors, known as the Blood Reaper Exorcists, had a unique role - they were the arbiters of the spirits fate.

Their task was not just to protect, but also to persuade other wandering spirits to aid in their cause. The judgement of the Blood Reaper Exorcists held the power to determine the destiny of these spirits.

The ancestors, therefore, endeavored to instill in their descendants a sense of justice and strong values. Their aim was to shape them into honorable and fearless warriors, who would act for the betterment of the spirit realm. This is the legacy that you have inherited - a lineage of respect, courage, and spiritual stewardship.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Thirst Sigili
entries: {@i 3rd-level Blood Reaper feature}

Starting at 3rd level, you expend 1 Sigili Glyph as a bonus action to mark a creature within 60ft of you for 1 minute. While marked in this way, you regain half of the damage you deal to that target (Rounded up) and you deal additional damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus. If you reduce the target to 0 hit points, you can do a weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn. You can only affect one creature at once with this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Scent
entries: {@i 3rd-level Blood Reaper feature}
You smell the blood of a damaged creature in the last minute. You gain 30ft of Blindsight against enemies who are not at maximum hp which have blood. You can also see hidden creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 5th-level Blood Reaper feature}
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bleeding Berserker
entries: {@i 9th-level Blood Reaper feature}

Your attacks now inflict severe injuries. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you leave the target constantly bleeding out for 1 minute. While bleeding, the target takes a numer of d6's of necrotic damage equal to the number of bleeding effects made to the target at the start of its turn. You can inflict a maximum of 5 bleeding stacks to the same target.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Weaver Ancestry
entries: Spirit Weaver Exorcists are unique beings, embodying values of healing, mending, and peace. Their primary mission is to assist spirits in finding tranquility within the spirit realm. Despite their pacifistic nature, they are not to be underestimated. When their sacred duty is threatened, they unleash a formidable power against their foes, revealing a side that belies their peaceful facade.

As a Spirit Weaver transcends to the afterlife, they leave behind subtle hints, guiding their successors on their path. Even in death, they continue to serve, providing ethereal counsel from the other side. Their life is a testament to their unwavering devotion to the spiritual realm, and even in rest, they remain a beacon for those who follow in their footsteps. This is the paradoxical existence of a Spirit Weaver - a peaceful warrior, a silent guide, and an eternal servant of the spirit realm.

subclassFeature.name: Supporting Spirit Sigili
entries: {@i 3rd-level Spirit Weaver feature}

As a bonus action, you can expend any number of Sigili Glyphs (Minimum of 1), to target a number of creatures within 60ft of youequal to the number of Sigili Glyphs expended. For 1 minute, creatures gain a bonus to attack rolls, checks and saving throws, equal to half your Proficiency bonus modifier (Rounded up).

subclassFeature.name: Mend the Soul
entries: {@i 3rd-level Spirit Weaver feature}
When you expend Sigili Glyphs for any of your Exorcist Features, you gain the following benefits depending on the target:

items: If the target was an ally or yourself, that target is healed by 2d6 for each Sigili Glyph expended.
If the target was an enemy, you can do a weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Weave the Soul
entries: {@i 5th-level Spirit Weaver feature}

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can manipulate the creature's soul force, leaving a spectral enbodiment of the creature's soul 5ft from the creature (Your choice where it is left) until the start of your next turn. When you, or an ally attack the spiritual embodiment with a weapon attack, the attacker deals a number of d4's equal to your Charisma modifier, plus your Proficiency bonus to the damage dealt.
The spectral embodiment shares the Hit points and Armor Class of the creature affected by Weave the soul.

subclassFeature.name: Power of the Silent
entries: {@i 9th-level Spirit Weaver feature}
Starting at 9th lvl, you obtain the following benefits:

items: The healing done by your Exorcist Features is doubled.
You add your Charisma modifier to any healing done by your Exorcist Features (This additional healing is not doubled by this feature).
When using Weave the Soul, you can now leave behind the spectral enbodiment before the attack hits, redirecting the attack to the spirit enbodiment.
The spectral embodiment has its AC reduced by 2.
